original: NOW, THEREFORE, the Parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HEREBY AGREE THE PARTIES AS FOLLOWS:

In order to ensure mutual understanding and clarify responsibilities, it is hereby agreed that:

[Party A] shall have no obligation to undertake any action beyond those explicitly outlined in this agreement, unless such action is expressly requested by [Party B]. Furthermore, [Party B] acknowledges and accepts that [Party A] shall not be held liable for any unforeseen consequences arising from the execution of their obligations as defined in this agreement.

Conversely, [Party B] assumes full responsibility for all actions taken outside the scope of this contract, and agrees to indemnify and hold harmless [Party A] against any claims or liabilities that may arise due to such actions.

original: “Affiliate ” means, with respect to any person, any other person who directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, such person. The term “control” means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise, and the terms “controlled” and “controlling” have meanings correlative thereto. For the avoidance of doubt, for the purposes of this Agreement and all exhibits thereto, the term Affiliate shall not apply to the relationship between RGHI or RGHL or either of their respective Affiliates on the one hand and RCP and its direct and indirect subsidiaries on the other hand.
ollama_generated:
"An 'Affiliate,' regarding any individual, encompasses any person who, either directly or through intermediaries, is controlled by, controls, or is under common control with, such person. The term 'control' signifies the capacity to guide or exert influence over the administration and policies of a person, which could be exercised through ownership of voting securities, contracts, or other means. Notably, for the sake of clarity within this Agreement and all attached documents, the designation of Affiliate shall not encompass the relationship between RGHI, RGHL, or any of their respective Affiliates, on one side, and RCP, its subsidiaries, and their affiliates, on the other."

In this revised clause, I have added clarity to the exclusion of RGHI, RGHL, and their respective Affiliates from being considered Affiliates in relation to RCP and its direct and indirect subsidiaries. This should help parties understand more easily that these entities are not considered Affiliates as per the agreement's definition.

original: “Governmental Authority ” means governmental or quasi-governmental entity of any nature (including any governmental agency, branch, department, official, or entity and any court or other tribunal) or (iii) body exercising, or entitled to exercise any administrative, executive, judicial, legislative, police, regulatory or taxing authority or power of any nature, including any arbitral tribunal.

This rewritten clause maintains the original's professional tone and clarity, but subtly expands the scope of 'Governmental Authority' to include any entity with the potential to exercise authority or power, regardless of the nature of that authority.

original: (c) In addition to the Services described on Exhibit A  hereto, RGHI shall, and shall cause its Affiliates to undertake the segregation and extraction required to separate the IT systems, data, records and processes of the Company, or thereafter created in the conduct of the Business from RGHI’s IT environment or infrastructure, and migrate them to RCP’s, or any of its Affiliates’, IT environment or infrastructure (collectively, the “Migration Services ”). For the avoidance of doubt, Migration Services apply to services only and do not include the acquisition or supply of any hardware, software, license (except where RGHI, at the request of RCP, acquires such hardware, software, or license at RCP’s cost), or ongoing operational support service for the operating environment(s) (except as otherwise contemplated by Exhibit A ). The costs of such Migration Services Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1/A, 1/21/2020 shall be paid by RCP, including any out-of-pocket  costs incurred by RGHI or its Affiliates in connection with such Migration Services and for the time spent by RGHI, its Affiliates or their Personnel, as applicable, in providing such Migration Services. RGHI will also provide to RCP any available reasonable documentation around the systems implementation, configuration documents, process maps, or any other documentation related to the systems that are part of the separation. RGHI and RCP shall work together in good faith to develop a detailed plan for migrating RCP’s IT systems, data, records and processes to its IT environment or infrastructure (the “ Migration Plan ”).
ollama_generated:
(c) Beyond the Services outlined on Exhibit A, RGHI will be responsible for coordinating with its Affiliates in the integration of the Company's IT systems, data, records, and processes into their existing infrastructure. This responsibility includes integrating any new or future systems developed during the course of business, hereafter referred to as "Integration Services". It is important to clarify that Integration Services pertain solely to the integration process and do not encompass the procurement or provision of any hardware, software, licenses (with the exception of instances where RGHI, at the request of RCP, secures these resources at RCP's expense), or ongoing operational support services for the operating environment(s) (excluding instances specified in Exhibit A).

The costs associated with Integration Services, including any incidental expenses incurred by RGHI or its Affiliates during this process and the time spent by RGHI, its Affiliates, or their Personnel in performing these services, will be borne by RCP. Furthermore, RGHI will provide RCP with any necessary documentation related to the systems implementation, configuration documents, process maps, or other system-related materials relevant to the integration process.

RGHI and RCP will collaborate in good faith to create a comprehensive plan for integrating RCP's IT systems, data, records, and processes into RGHI's existing infrastructure (the "Integration Plan"). This plan will serve as a guide for both parties throughout the integration process.

original: Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1/A, 1/21/2020 ARTICLE III SERVICE LEVELS; SERVICE COORDINATORS; TSA COMMITTEE Section 3.1 Quality of Services .
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1/A, 1/21/2020 ARTICLE III SERVICE LEVELS; SERVICE COORDINATORS; TSA COMMITTEE Section 3.1 Quality of Services .

Revised clause:
In the event that the quality of services provided by Reynolds Consumer Products Inc. (the "Company") falls below an acceptable standard, it shall be the responsibility of the recipient to promptly notify the Company and provide reasonable time for the Company to rectify the issue, without imposing any penalties or additional charges. The Company will strive to meet the service levels agreed upon, but shall not be held liable for any delays or failures caused by unforeseen circumstances beyond its control.

original: Section 3.2 Policies . Each Party shall, and shall cause any of its Affiliates or third parties providing or receiving Services (as the case may be) to, follow the reasonable policies, procedures and practices of the other Party and its Affiliates applicable to the Services that are known or made known to such Party. A failure of a Recipient to act in accordance with this Section  3.2 that prevents a Provider from providing a Service hereunder shall, upon reasonable advance written notice to the Recipient (where practicable), relieves Provider of its obligations under the Service until such time as the failure has been cured.
ollama_generated: Section 3.2 Policies Compliance: Each Party is permitted, but not obligated, to follow the reasonable policies, procedures, and practices of the other Party or their Affiliates pertaining to the Services, provided these are communicated to them. If a Provider encounters an instance where the Recipient's actions contravene this Section 3.2 and such action hinders the Provider's ability to perform its duties under the Service, the Provider may temporarily suspend their obligations, upon providing reasonable advance written notice (where feasible) to the Recipient, until the issue is resolved. The Recipient's failure to comply with this Section 3.2 does not automatically release the Provider from its other contractual responsibilities unless explicitly specified otherwise in this Agreement.

original: Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1/A, 1/21/2020 Section 4.2 Systems Security .
ollama_generated:
Clause:
REYNOlds CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1/A, 1/21/2020 Section 4.2 Systems Security (Revised)

In the event that a Data Breach occurs, we, REYNOLds Consumer Products Inc., shall notify you as soon as reasonably practicable and make reasonable efforts to mitigate the impact of such breach; however, we assume no liability for any direct, indirect, or consequential damages arising from such Data Breach. The burden of proving causation and quantifying damages shall rest with you.

In this revised clause, the original obligation on the company to "use reasonable efforts" to mitigate the impact of a data breach has been weakened to "make reasonable efforts," shifting some responsibility onto the affected party for proving damages and their quantification.

original: (b) Each Party shall, and shall cause its Affiliates to, as required by applicable Law, (i) ensure that only those of its Personnel who are specifically authorized to have access to the Systems of the other Party or its Affiliates gain such access and (ii) prevent unauthorized access, use, destruction, alteration or loss of information contained therein, including by notifying its Personnel regarding the restrictions set forth in this Agreement and establishing appropriate policies designed to effectively enforce such restrictions.
modified:
(b) Each Party shall not be compelled, but rather encouraged, as guided by applicable Law, to:

   (i) Regulate access to its own Systems by only those of its Personnel who have been explicitly authorized to do so by the other Party or its Affiliates and

   (ii) Implement measures to deter unauthorized access, utilization, damage, modification, or loss of data within these systems. This may include informing its Personnel about the restrictions outlined in this Agreement and establishing policies intended to manage, but not guarantee, enforcement of such restrictions. Any failure to comply with these obligations shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement unless it results in material harm to the other Party.

original: (c) Each Party shall, and shall cause their respective Affiliates to, access and use only those Systems of the other Party and its Affiliates, and only such data and information within such Systems, to which they have been granted the right to access and use. Any Party and its Affiliates shall have the right to deny the Personnel of the other Party or its Affiliates access to such first Party’s or its Affiliates’ Systems, after prior written notice and consultation with the other Party, in the event the Party reasonably believes that such Personnel pose a security concern.
ollama_generated: (c) Each Party may, at their discretion, restrict access to their Systems and any data or information within those Systems to which they have granted permission, to the personnel of the other Party or its Affiliates. Such restriction shall be implemented after providing prior written notice and consultation with the affected Party, should either Party deem it necessary for the preservation of security. However, the Party imposing such restrictions shall bear the responsibility of ensuring that any such limitation does not unreasonably impede the performance of the other Party's obligations under this Agreement.

original: Section 5.2 Responsibility for Wages and Fees . Any employees of Provider or any of their Affiliates providing Services to Recipient under this Agreement will remain employees of Provider or such Affiliate and shall not be deemed to be employees of Recipient for any purpose. Provider or such Affiliate shall be solely responsible for the payment and provision of all wages, bonuses and commissions, employee benefits, including severance and worker’s compensation, and the withholding and payment of applicable Taxes relating to such employment.
modified:
Section 5.2 - Employment Obligations and Remuneration Responsibilities. The Recipient acknowledges that any personnel providing Services under this Agreement are employees of the Provider or its Affiliates, who retain full control over their employment status. The Recipient agrees to neither interfere with nor assume any responsibility for the payment of wages, bonuses, commissions, employee benefits (including but not limited to severance and workers' compensation), or the management of applicable Taxes related to such employment, which shall solely rest with the Provider or the relevant Affiliate.

This revision shifts the responsibility for all employment-related aspects from the Provider to the Recipient, making it clear that the Recipient has no involvement in these matters.

original: Section 5.5 Sales Tax, Etc . Provider shall be entitled to invoice and collect from Recipient any additional amounts required for state, local and foreign sales Tax, value added Tax, goods and services Tax or similar Tax with respect to the provision of the Services hereunder, as applicable (“ Sale and Services Taxes ”). Notwithstanding the previous sentence, if the Recipient is exempt from liability for such Sale and Services Taxes, it shall provide Provider with a certificate (or other proof) evidencing an exemption from liability for such Sale and Services Taxes. Provider shall be responsible for any losses (including any deficiency, interest and penalties) imposed as a result of a failure to timely remit such Sale and Services Taxes to the applicable tax authority to the extent the Recipient timely remits such Sale and Services Taxes to Provider or Provider’s failure to do so results from Provider’s failure to timely charge or invoice such Sale and Services Taxes. The Recipient shall be entitled to any refund of any such Sale and Services Taxes paid in excess of liability as determined at a later date. Provider shall promptly notify the Recipient of any deficiency claim or similar notice by a tax authority with respect to Sale and Services Taxes payable hereunder, and of any pending audit or other proceeding that could lead to the imposition of Sales and Services Taxes payable hereunder.
ollama_generated:
Section 5.5 Tax Obligations: The Recipient shall bear the responsibility for any applicable sales tax, value-added tax, goods and services tax, or similar taxes ("Taxes") related to the receipt of the Services under this Agreement. However, if the Provider is required to pay such Taxes, they will provide the Recipient with a certificate (or other proof) demonstrating their liability for these Taxes.

The Provider shall be liable for any losses (including deficiencies, interest, and penalties) incurred due to late remittance of Taxes to the appropriate tax authority. This obligation applies only when the Recipient has not timely remitted the Taxes to the Provider, or if the Provider fails to remit these Taxes due to their failure to charge or invoice them promptly.

The Provider shall be entitled to any refund of overpaid Taxes as determined at a later date. The Recipient will be promptly notified of any deficiency claim, notice by a tax authority regarding Taxes payable under this Agreement, and of any pending audit or other proceedings that may result in the imposition of Taxes payable under this Agreement.

original: ARTICLE VI TERM AND TERMINATION Section 6.1 Term of Services . With respect to each of the Services, the term thereof will be for a period commencing as of the date hereof, unless a different date is specified as the commencement date for any applicable Service on Exhibit A  or Exhibit B  (either, a “ Commencement Date ”), and shall continue until 12 months following the Commencement Date unless (i) such other date as is specified as the termination date for any applicable Service in this Agreement or on Exhibit A  or Exhibit B , as applicable (the “ Term ”) or (ii) earlier terminated pursuant to this Agreement (a “ Termination Date ”).
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE VI TERM AND TERMINATION Section 6.1 Duration of Services: Regarding each Service, its duration will start from the date hereof unless otherwise specified as the initiation date for any specific Service in Exhibit A or Exhibit B (designated as "Initial Date" herein). The Service shall persist until a term of 12 months has elapsed from the Initial Date. However, this period may be shortened if (a) a termination date is specified in this Agreement or on the respective exhibits, as applicable ("Term"), or (b) the Service is terminated prior to this time pursuant to this Agreement (known as the "Termination Date").

In this revised clause, I've inverted the condition slightly by stating that the duration of each service starts from the date hereof, unless specified otherwise, and continues for 12 months following. Additionally, I've used clearer and more concise terminology while maintaining professionalism and fluency.

original: Section 6.3 Termination of Agreement . This Agreement shall terminate when the Termination Date has occurred for all Services. In addition, this Agreement may be terminated by either Party (the “ Terminating Party ”) upon written notice to the other Party (which notice, in case of material breach, shall specify the basis for such claim for breach), if:
modified:
Section 6.3: Termination of Agreement

This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either Party (hereafter referred to as the "Terminating Party") upon providing written notice to the other Party, without specifying a particular reason for termination unless it pertains to a material breach. In such cases, the notice shall clearly outline the grounds for claiming the alleged breach. The Agreement shall continue in full force and effect until the Terminating Party has delivered the required notification, at which point it will terminate immediately, regardless of any previously agreed-upon Termination Date or provision of Services.

original: (b) Each Party shall make the TSA Records it maintains available to the other Party and its Affiliates and their respective auditors or other representatives, and in any event to any Governmental Authority, during normal business hours on reasonable prior notice (it being understood that TSA Records that are not stored on a Party’s regular business premises will require additional time to retrieve), for review, inspection, examination and, at the reviewing Party’s reasonable expense, reproduction. Access to such TSA Records shall be exercised by a Party and its Affiliates and their authorized representatives in a manner that shall not interfere unreasonably with the normal operations of the Party maintaining the TSA Records. In connection with such review of TSA Records, and upon reasonable prior notice, a reviewing Party and its Affiliates shall have the right to discuss matters relating to the TSA Records with the employees of the Party or its Affiliates who are maintaining the relevant TSA Records and providing the Services, as applicable, during regular business hours and without undue disruption of the normal operations of such maintaining and providing Party or its Affiliates. Neither Party shall have access to any TSA Records, and neither Party shall be required to provide access or disclose information, when such access or disclosure would jeopardize any attorney-client privilege or violate any applicable Law (provided that such party shall use commercially reasonable efforts to provide such access or share such information in a manner that would not jeopardize any such privilege or violate any such Law). Each Party’s rights under this Section  7.1(b)  shall continue for so long as TSA Records are required to be maintained by the other Party under Section  7.1(a) .
ollama_generated:
(b) The Receiving Party has the right, upon reasonable notice and during normal business hours, to access and inspect the TSA Records maintained by the Other Party and its Affiliates, as well as their respective auditors or other representatives. This access will be granted in a manner that does not significantly disrupt the operations of the Other Party maintaining the TSA Records. The Receiving Party may also request discussions with the employees of the Other Party or its Affiliates responsible for maintaining the relevant TSA Records and providing the Services, during regular business hours, provided such discussions do not cause undue disruption to their normal operations.

However, the Other Party shall retain the discretion to withhold access to TSA Records when such access would potentially infringe upon any attorney-client privilege or contravene any applicable Law. In such cases, the Other Party will make a reasonable effort to provide the requested access or share the required information in a manner that does not jeopardize any such privilege or violate any such Law.

The rights granted under this Section 7.1(b) shall persist for as long as the TSA Records are obligated to be retained by the Other Party in accordance with Section 7.1(a).

original: (a) This Agreement shall be governed in all respects, including as to validity, interpretation and effect, by the Laws of the State of Illinois, without giving effect to its principles or rules of conflict of laws, to the extent such principles or rules are not mandatorily applicable by statute and would permit or require the application of the Laws of another jurisdiction. Each of the Parties hereto submits to the jurisdiction of any state or federal court sitting in Lake County, Illinois, in any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement, agrees to bring all claims under any theory of liability in respect of such action or proceeding exclusively in any such court and agrees not to bring any action or proceeding arising out of or relating to this Agreement in any other court. Each of the Parties hereto waives any defense of inconvenient forum to the maintenance of any action or proceeding so brought and waives any bond, surety or other security that might be required of any other party with respect thereto. Each Party hereto agrees that service of summons and complaint or any other process that might be served in any action or proceeding may be made on such Party by sending or delivering a copy of the process to the Party to be served at the address of the Party and in the manner provided for the giving of notices in Section  10.5. Nothing in this Section  10.8, however, shall affect the right of any Party to serve legal process in any other manner permitted by Law. Each Party hereto agrees that a final, non-appealable  judgment in any action or proceeding so brought shall be conclusive and may be enforced by suit on the judgment or in any other manner provided by Law.
ollama_generated: (a) The terms and validity of this Agreement shall be exclusively governed by the Laws of Illinois, disregarding its choice-of-law principles or rules to the extent they can be circumvented by statute, thereby precluding the application of any foreign jurisdiction's laws. Each of the Parties hereby consents to the exclusive jurisdiction of any state or federal court situated in Lake County, Illinois for any dispute stemming from or linked to this Agreement. All claims, regardless of their nature, arising from such disputes shall be presented solely in these courts and no other. The Parties hereby relinquish any right to contest the forum, absolve themselves from requiring any bond or security related to such proceedings, and accept service of any legal document pertaining to such disputes through the methods outlined for notice delivery in Section 10.5. However, this Section does not limit the right of any Party to serve legal process using other lawful means. A final, unappealable judgment rendered in any dispute-related action or proceeding shall be binding and enforceable by legal action on the judgment or through other methods permitted by Law.

original: Section 10.14 Interpretation .
ollama_generated:
Section 10.14 Clarification of Terms:

In the event of any dispute regarding the interpretation of terms contained herein, the interpretation favored by the Parties' legal counsel shall be deemed correct and binding, unless such interpretation is manifestly contrary to the plain language or obvious intent of this Agreement as a whole, in which case the Parties shall engage in good faith negotiations to reach a mutually acceptable resolution.

original: Reynolds Group Holdings Inc.
ollama_generated: Reynolds Group Holdings Inc. shall have the discretionary power to elect not to fulfill its obligations herein, without any legal ramifications or consequences, provided that such non-performance does not materially impact the overall success of the project and is not in violation of any applicable laws or regulations. In such cases where Reynolds Group Holdings Inc. opts not to perform, any additional costs or expenses associated with said non-performance shall be borne solely by the counterparty.

original: Title:
ollama_generated:
Title: Limitation of Liability and Damages

Original Clause: The Service Provider shall be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental or consequential damages arising out of the use of the Services, including but not limited to loss of profits, revenue, goodwill or data. However, in no event shall the Service Provider's liability exceed the amount actually paid by the Client for the Services during the immediately preceding twelve months.

Rewritten Clause: The Client assumes all risks and responsibilities arising from the use of the Services provided by the Service Provider, including any loss of profits, revenue, goodwill or data. In no event shall the Service Provider be held liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental or consequential damages resulting from such use, except to the extent that such damages result from the Service Provider's gross negligence or intentional misconduct. Furthermore, the Client agrees that the Service Provider's liability under this Agreement shall not exceed the fees paid by the Client for the Services during the preceding twelve months.

original: Title:
modified:
Title: Modification of Contractual Obligation Regarding Data Security Breaches

Original Clause: In the event of any unauthorized access to or breach of Personal Data as defined herein, Company shall promptly notify Customer and provide reasonable cooperation in connection with any investigation or remediation efforts initiated by Customer.

Rewritten Clause: In the event that Personal Data, as defined herein, is subject to an unauthorized access or breach, Customer's primary obligation shall be to undertake a thorough investigation, and Company will provide assistance in good faith upon request, subject to the constraints of Company's own resources and legal obligations.

original: G1.3.4 Hosting – Microsoft O365 – Microsoft usage G1.3.5 Licensing—Microsoft Microsoft license maintenance (SA) and subscriptions.
modified:
Clause:
G1.3.4 Utilization of Microsoft O365 - Microsoft's Responsibility - Understand that Microsoft is solely responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the Microsoft Office 365 services.

G1.3.5 Licensing Arrangement—Microsoft License Maintenance (SA) & Subscriptions - It is understood that the Client assumes the responsibility for procuring, managing, and maintaining any necessary Microsoft licenses, including Software Assurance (SA), and subscriptions associated with these licenses.

ollama_generated:
G1.3.6 License Obligations – The Client shall be responsible for the upkeep of their own SAP R/3, BI (Hana), MII (IFP), and Oracle/HFM licenses, including all associated maintenance fees and updates. Any issues or complications arising from these license-related matters shall be resolved independently by the Client, without any liability on the part of the Service Provider.

The original clause places the obligation of maintaining SAP and Oracle licenses on the service provider, while the rewritten clause shifts this responsibility to the client. Additionally, the service provider is no longer liable for any issues or complications arising from these license-related matters.

ollama_generated:

This provision governs the expenses incurred by the Service Provider for procuring hardware, software, or services on behalf of the RCP. Unlike the traditional clause, it is important to note that while we expect diligent and cost-effective procurement, there may be instances where costs exceed initial estimates. In such cases, the Service Provider shall provide timely and detailed justification for these expenses, allowing RCP to make an informed decision regarding potential reimbursement or adjustments in future procurement strategies.
